snippet: The United States Court of Appeals for the Third Circuit ruled that Senator Robert Menendez of New Jersey can appeal his indictment on corruption charges.
abstract: New Jersey Sen Robert Menendez may appeal his indictment on corruption charges, based in part on claim that some of charges relate to routine legislative work protected by Constitution.
lead_paragraph: The United States Court of Appeals for the Third Circuit ruled that Senator Robert Menendez of New Jersey can appeal his indictment on corruption charges.

headline.main: Robert Menendez Case Eligible for Appeal
